ygData.subject: A new Neuroevolution project (Darwin)
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello fellow NEAT enthusiasts, I d like to introduce a new Evolutionary Algorithms framework with a focus on Neuroevolution: https://github.com/tlemo/darwin

Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="0000000000003a2a05057d90b1ff"
Subject: A new Neuroevolution project (Darwin)
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=583156503
From: Leonard <lemo1234@...>


--0000000000003a2a05057d90b1ff
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"

Hello fellow NEAT enthusiasts,

I'd like to introduce a new Evolutionary Algorithms framework with a focus
on Neuroevolution: https://github.com/tlemo/darwin

Being a fan of Ken Stanley's work, one of the first included algorithms is
NEAT. This is an independent implementation based on the original NEAT
paper, with a few variations:

   1. There's an experimental LSTM node type. Currently this is a limited
   experiment (if enabled all the hidden nodes are LSTM nodes and the LSTM
   weights are shared)
   2. The network activation is different: it's based on a topological sort
   order and not the iterative ("timesteps") approach I noticed in the
   original implementation.
   3. Since the starting point was the NEAT paper rather than one of the
   existing implementations it's likely that there are more differences (for
   example the speciation and crossover implementation).

I hope some of you will find this new framework useful. Feedback is
always welcome!

Cheers!
Leonard Mosescu.

--0000000000003a2a05057d90b1ff
Content-Type: text/html; charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
